reasoning: Chronic symptom syndrome measured as prevalence, not incidence. Population-based surveys show ~12% of adults globally have OAB symptoms (12,000 per 100k). EPIC study and similar surveys provide robust prevalence data.
source: Irwin DE et al. (2006). Population-based survey of urinary incontinence, overactive bladder, and other lower urinary tract symptoms in five countries: results of the EPIC study. Eur Urol. 50(6):1306-14
